items.value:
The hash value in bits for MD5 is ____.
A. 128
B. 160
C. 256

Hashing involves taking a _____ length input and producing a _____ length output (message digest).
A. fixed; fixed
B. variable; fixed
C. fixed; variable

The hash value in bits for SHA-1 is ____.
A. 128
B. 160
C. 256

The hash value in bits for MD4 is ____.
A. 128
B. 160
C. 256

IPSec ______ mode involves "end-to-end" encryption; i.e. data remains encrypted from the time it leaves a sender's device to the time it arrives at the receiver's device.
A. Tunnel
B. Transport
C. Trusted

IPSec ______ mode involves encryption from gateway to gateway, i.e. just through the public network space.
A. Tunnel
B. Transport
C. Trusted

items.key:
Tunnel

Remember, with tunnel mode, encryption does not happen until just before it leaves the local network. Traffic likely remains unencrypted between the end user device and the local network boundary.
items.value:
A security analyst on a local network using monitoring tools is likely to only be able to read contents of traffic encrypted using IPSec ______ mode.
A. Tunnel
B. Transport
C. Trusted

_____ is a lightweight cryptography method for signing messages (MAC). It boasts a relatively undemanding hardware implementation (only ~3,333 gates required at 1MHz clock rate) making it suitable for IoT implementation.

Chaskey has a key size of _____ bits.
A. 256
B. 128
C. 80

A weakness of one-way hashing is that the same piece of plaintext will result in the same ciphertext unless _____ is applied.
A. Salt
B. Ash
C. Ether

B. 20
C. 64

C. 1024

A. DES

C. rainbow table

items.key: Sign the certificate with the CA's own private key
items.value:
What step will a certificate authority (CA) take after generating a digital certificate for a requester, but before issuing the certificate to that requester?
A. Sign the certificate with the CA's own private key
B. Sign the certificate with the CA's own public key
C. Sign the certificate with the requester's private key

_______ refers to the mapping of our alphabet to a number of cipher alphabets.
A. Mono-alphabetic
B. Polyalphabetic
C. Pseudo-random
_____ is considered to be unbreakable since it only uses its cipher code once.
_____ encoding involves 8-bit values and supports up to 256 characters.

A _____ occurs when two different input values produce the same hash signature.
A. collision
B. rainbow
C. tunnel
_____ is an encoding method with 16-bit values and supports up to 65,536 characters.

The light-weight symmetric stream cipher Trivium operates with a key size of ______ bits and an initialization vector (IV) of _____ bits.
A. 80; 80
B. 64; 128
C. 128; 64

A _____ is a tamper-evident and intrusion-resistant physical device that safeguards and manages cryptographic keys and provides cryptographic processing.
A. TPM
B. HSM
C. DES

A. TPM
B. HSM
C. PRNG

A. HMAC
B. Rainbow table
C. Key escrow
_____ ciphers make use of a single secret key for both encryption and decryption.

The two types of symmetric ciphers are _____ and _____
A. Block, Stream
B. CTR, DES
C. Active, Passive

When encrypting data using asymmetric cryptography, which key should be shared or distributed to facilitate decryption?
A. Secret key
B. Private key
C. Public key

A. Stream ciphers

C. Padding

A. ECB, DES, ECC
B. CFB, OFB, CTR
C. DSA, RSA, RC6

Symmetric block ciphers make use of _____ to perform substitution as part the encryption process.
A. p-boxes
B. s-boxes

A. 32
B. 64
C. 128

A. Symmetric
B. Asymmetric
C. Hash

When encrypting data using symmetric cryptography, which key may need to be exchanged to facilitate decryption?
A. Secret key
B. Private key
C. Public key

RC5 is a conventional symmetric block cipher that is suitable for light-weight implementations. It has a variable key size with a max of _____bits.
A. 128
B. 256
C. 2048

What is the block and key size in bits used by the light-weight symmetric block cipher CLEFIA?
A. 64 bit blocks; 64 bit keys
B. 64 or 80 bit blocks; 128 bit keys
C. 128 bit blocks; 128, 192, or 256 bit keys

If Shawn employs public key cryptography to send Sue a digitally signed message, which key will Sue use to decrypt the message?
A. Sue's private key
B. Shawn's private key
C. Sue's public key

A. Cramer-Shoup
B. Ephemeral
C. Key Clustering

With _____ encryption, we can perform mathematical operations on ciphered values i.e., before decryption.

B. Homomorphic
C. Quantum

A. One Time Passwords (OTP)

C. Timed One Time Password (TOTP)

A. DER
B. PEM
C. MAC

A. Sue's private key
B. Shawn's private key
C. Sue's public key

If Shawn employs public key cryptography to send Sue a digitally signed message, which key will Sue use to verify the message?
A. Sue's private key
B. Shawn's public key
C. Sue's public key

Rabbit, Mickey v2, Trivium, Grain, and Enocoro are examples of light-weight _____ ciphers.
A. Symmetric block
B. Symmetric stream
C. Public-key

If Shawn plans to employ public key cryptography to send Sue a digitally signed message, which key will Shawn use to encrypt the message?
A. Sue's private key
B. Sue's public key
C. Shawn's public key

Which encoding scheme for x.509 certificates supports binary formats?
A. DER
B. PEM
C. MAC

_____ describes one-way or irreversible encryption used for protecting the integrity of data and in authentication applications.
A. Symmetric encryption
B. Hashing
C. Key escrow

A. non-cryptographic
B. light-weight
C. conventional

NIST categorizes embedded systems, RFID, and sensor networks as devices within the device spectrum for _____cryptography.
A. non-cryptographic
B. light-weight
C. conventional

A. One Time Passwords (OTP)
B. Hashed One Time Passwords (HOTP)

A. One Time Passwords (OTP)

C. 51

With SSL/TLS, the tunnel is created with a _____ key method, and then a signature is created with a defined hashing method.

B. symmetric

A. Virtual Private Network (VPN)
B. Telnet
C. Virtual machine

A. Onion routing

Establishing a fingerprint or thumbprint in cryptography is achieved by _____ algorithms.
A. symmetric
B. asymmetric
C. Hash

A blockchain mining process where a new block of transactions is added to the blockchain and transactions within the block are considered to be processed occurs every ______ minutes or so.
A. 60
B. 30
C. 10

_____ describes a ledger of transactions that allows the Bitcoin network to know the number of bitcoins that a given user has in their account.
A. BTC
B. Blockchain
C. Ether

Bitcoin transactions will be captured by ______ who will compile a list of the latest transactions.
A. miners
B. bankers
C. administrators

Regarding blockchain, miners receive _____ for successful mining efforts.
A. penalties
B. rewards
C. contracts

_____ are programs stored on a blockchain that run when predetermined conditions are met; they typically are used to automate the execution of an agreement so that all participants can be immediately certain of the outcome, without an intermediary's involvement or time loss.
A. Pseudo codes
B. Smart contracts
C. Miners

Within Ethereum applications we define the concept of _____ . This is basically the unit that is used to measure the amount of work that is required to perform a single Keccak-256 hash.
A. gas
B. mining
C. smart contracts

A _____ backdoor describes an instance where it is where it is mathematically possible for government agents to crack the encryption, but no-one else can.
A. true random
B. key escrow
C. NOBUS

Cipher cracking method where the intruder uses brute force to decrypt the ciphertext and tries every possible key.
A. Exhaustive search.
B. Known plaintext
C. Active Attack

Cipher cracking method where the intruder is hidden between two parties and impersonates each of them to the other.
A. MITM
B. Known plaintext
C. Cut-and-paste

Cipher cracking method where the intruder knows part of the ciphertext and the corresponding plaintext. The known ciphertext and plaintext can then be used to decrypt the rest of the ciphertext.
A. Exhaustive search
B. Known plaintext
C. Active Attack

Which certificate management stage certificate involves certificate retrieval/recovery and certificate validation?
A. Initialization
B. Issued
C. Cancellation

During which stage of certificate management does certificate expiration and revocation take place?
A. Initialization
B. Issued
C. Cancellation

Certificate distribution takes place in the _____ stage of certificate management.
A. Initialization
B. Issued
C. Cancellation

A CRL must be published by the _____ who originally generated the targeted certificates.
A. RA
B. CA
C. Certificate owner

An alterative to the CRL is to use_____, an online service used to check the validity of a certificate.
A. OSCP
B. OCSP
C. OWASP

A certificate that has been compromised, updated, or superseded warrants being ______.
A. escrowed
B. signed
C. revoked

A ____attack involves determining the amount of time that a user takes to decrypt the message; from this the key could be found.
A. Time
B. Time resetting
C. Replay

A ___ attack is where an attacker mixes parts of two different encrypted messages and is able to create a new message. This message is likely to make no sense but may trick the receiver into doing something that helps the intruder.
A. Replay
B. Man-in-the-middle
C. Cut-and-paste

____ describes an instance where an attacker takes a legitimate message and sends it into the network at some future time.
A. Crypto Spoofing
B. The replay system
C Known plaintext attack

A ___ attack occurs when an attacker is hidden between two parties and impersonates each of them to the other.
A. Time resetting
B. Man-in-the-middle
C. Brute force

Key escrow and NOBUS (nobody but us) are two methods that can facilitate a ____ condition in cryptography.
A. backdoor
B. lockout
C. exhaustive

Ethereum, and Hyperledger are considered common options for implementing _____.
A. secure tunnels
B. Message digests
C blockchain

___ is an early cipher that makes use of a grid and which maps the letters into numeric values.
A. Pigpen
B. Caesar
C. Bifid

_____ is an early cipher that uses a 5  5 matrix containing the alphabet less the letter J. Cipher/decipher process consists of a set of rules outlining use of column and row combinations.
A. Pigpen
B. Playfair
C. Enigma

______ is a mono-alphabetic substitution cipher that makes use of mapping plaintext characters to graphical characters rather than to alphabetic ones.
A. Pigpen
B. Playfair
C. Enigma

______ is polyalphabetic early cipher that involves using a different mapping, based on a keyword, for each character of the cipher.
A. Rail Code
B. Playfair
C. Vigenere

_____ is a mono-alphabetic substitution cipher known as "shift" cipher that involves plaintext being replaced by a letter some fixed number of positions down the alphabet.
A. Vigenere
B. Four-square cipher
C. Caesar

_____ is an early cipher that uses four 5  5 matrices arranged in a square, are where each matrix contains 25 letters for encoding and decoding operations.
A. Playfair
B. Four-square cipher
C. Caesar

What is the block size for AES?
A. 128 bits
B. 192 bits
C. 256 bits

With the _____ block cipher mode, the encrypted version of the IV produced in the first stage (during processing of the first block) is fed into the second stage and encrypted.
A. OFB
B. CTR
C. CFB

What is the key size for 3DES?
A. 64 bits
B. 112 bits
C. 80 bits

AES when operating with 10 rounds uses what key size?
A. 128 bits
B. 192 Bits
C 256 bits

AES when operating with 10 rounds uses what block size?
A. 128 bits
B. 192 Bits
C 256 bits

AES when operating with 12 rounds uses what block size?

A. ECDSA
B. secp256k1
C. ECDH

C. passive

PKCS #__ is a standard used for password-based encryption.

B. 5

A. ECB

A. AES

A. Padding

items.key:
__________ is an Internet standard approach to e - mail security that incorporates the same functionality as PGP.
A) MIME
B) HTTPS
C) DKIM
D) S/MIME
items.value: D

items.key:
PGP provides authentication through the use of _________ .
A) symmetric block encryption
B) radix-64
C) Asymmetric block encryption
D) Digital Signatures
items.value: D

items.key:
PGP provides e-mail compatibility using the __________ encoding scheme.
A) radix-64
B) MIME
C) digital signature
D) symmetric block
items.value: A

items.key:
The __________ enables the recipient to determine if the correct public key was used to decrypt the message digest for authentication.
A) key ID of the sender's public key
B) leading two octets of message digest
C) filename
D) timestamp
items.value: B

items.key:
Key IDs are critical to the operation of PGP and __________ key IDs are included in any PGP message that provides both confidentiality and authentication
A) two
B) six
C) four
D) three
items.value: A

MIME is an extension to the ________ framework that is intended to address some of the problems and limitations of the use of SMTP
A) RFC 821
B) RFC 3852
C) RFC 4871
D) RFC 5322
items.value: D

items.key:

A) Content - Description
B) Content - Type
C) Content - ID
D) Content - Transfer - Encoding

items.key:
The __________ field is used to identify MIME entities uniquely in multiple contexts.
A) Content-Description
B) Content-ID
C) Content-Transfer-Enconding
D) Content-Type

A) JPEG
B) MPEG
C) GIF
D) BMP
items.value: B

B) multipart/digest

D) multipart/mixed

A) multipart/mixed
B) multipart/digest
C) multipart/alternative
D) multipart/parallel

B) SHOULD and MUST
C) CAN and MUST
D) SHOULD and CAN

A) Class 2
B) Class 4
C) Class 3
D) Class 1

A) Message Transfer Agent
B) Mail Submission Agent

D) Message Store
